'''Almiel''' ([[Quenya|Q]], pron. {{IPA|[ˈalmi.el]}}, stem ''Almield-'') was the third child and second daughter of [[Tar-Meneldur]] and [[Almarian]].  Her older brother was [[Tar-Aldarion|Anardil]], who when he became king was known as [[Tar-Aldarion]].<ref>{{UT|Kings}}</ref>

When Aldarion built the great ship [[Palarran]] Tar-Meneldur was angry.  Though Queen Almarian stayed the king from prohibiting Aldarion from sailing, the king did forbid his wife and daughters from bringing a bough of ''[[oiolairë]]'' to the ship.  Because Almarian, Ailinel, and Almiel obeyed the king's command it gave [[Erendis]] the opportunity to present the token of goodwill to the prince, which kindled love in Aldarion for Erendis.<ref>{{UT|Wife}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Almiel'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests it means "Blessed Daughter" and is a compound of ''[[alma|almë]]'' ("good (or blessed) thing", "blessing", "piece of good fortune") and ''[[-iel]]'' (feminine suffix, "-daughter").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2220848169.html|articlename=Q. ''Almiel'' f.|website=Eldamo|accessed=21 January 2022}}</ref>
